posts.post_content:
For your enjoyment, I present an "Ask Wizards" answer to the question:   
"Do you ever plan on creating a white creature that has a power above 4 again, and have the casting cost be fair?"  
Mike Eliot answered this back in 2002:  
"...White will be unlikely to get strong constructed cards with fat stats -- that isn't really white's strength -- but you may see the occasional white legend with higher stats and somewhat reasonable mana costs. So, sorry, the 6/6 white groundpounder will always have to pay through the nose for the extra stats."  
  
Don't get me wrong; I love the card, AND the fact that these guys are exceptions to the rule.   
Sun Titan needed to be part of a cycle to get printed. All the beefy white fliers that cost X and have stats of X/X, where X is greater than 3 are rare.  
  
The article is here:  
http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtgcom/askwizards
posts.html:

So, sorry, the 6/6 white groundpounder will always have to pay through the nose for the extra stats."

Don't get me wrong; I love the card, AND the fact that these guys are exceptions to the rule.
Sun Titan needed to be part of a cycle to get printed. All the beefy white fliers that cost X and have stats of X/X, where X is greater than 3 are rare.

posts.post_content:
This card is a godsend for those who want to play UW control, but can't afford a playset of baneslayer or Jace, the Mind Sculptor (wallet sculptor).  
  
He is just SO good in UW control, and he -sorta- takes baneslayer's slot. And the possibility for recursion with Jace Beleren makes having Jace the Mind Sculptor not -quite so much of- a necessity!  
  
In just the generic UW build, he can bring back:  
  
-Tectonic Edge for continual non-basic land disruption and manland killing  
-Celestial Colonnades and Glacial Fortresses that have been Tectonic edge-d by an opponent  
-O ring (if it gets countered- which happens surprisingly often in the mirror match) to exile permanents  
-Wall of Omens to draw a card and get a chump blocker  
-Jace Beleren for legend rule mayhem and perpetual card advantage  
-Kor Firewalker to own the red matchup just a little bit more   
  
If you get creative, you can even try using his synergy with:  
-Meddling mage to destroy combo decks (no polymorph/ runeflare trap/ primeval titan... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

In just the generic UW build, he can bring back:

-Tectonic Edge for continual non-basic land disruption and manland killing
-Celestial Colonnades and Glacial Fortresses that have been Tectonic edge-d by an opponent
-O ring (if it gets countered- which happens surprisingly often in the mirror match) to exile permanents
-Wall of Omens to draw a card and get a chump blocker
-Jace Beleren for legend rule mayhem and perpetual card advantage
-Kor Firewalker to own the red matchup just a little bit more

If you get creative, you can even try using his synergy with:
-Meddling mage to destroy combo decks (no polymorph/ runeflare trap/ primeval titan... (see all)

posts.post_content:
The rating process is supposed to be objective. People who give cards .5 because they "don't feel like playing against it" really shouldn't be rating anything. Ever.  
  
[Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan) has proven itself the best titan, but this is the second best imo (although second place is definitely debatable with [grave titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=grave titan) around). There are so many killer permanents with CiP abilities that he can abuse. Creatures like [Wall of Omens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Omens), [Sea Gate Oracle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sea Gate Oracle) and [Aether Adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aether Adept) are boss with this. Or you could pull up a [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) and equip him with it.   
  
One of the craziest strategies is to keep drawing two cards a turn with [Jace Beleren](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace Beleren), then bring him right back when he runs out of loyalty (meaning you draw three cards that turn).
posts.html:
The rating process is supposed to be objective. People who give cards .5 because they "don't feel like playing against it" really shouldn't be rating anything. Ever.

Primeval Titan has proven itself the best titan, but this is the second best imo (although second place is definitely debatable with grave titan around). There are so many killer permanents with CiP abilities that he can abuse. Creatures like Wall of Omens, Sea Gate Oracle and Aether Adept are boss with this. Or you could pull up a Whispersilk Cloak and equip him with it.

One of the craziest strategies is to keep drawing two cards a turn with Jace Beleren, then bring him right back when he runs out of loyalty (meaning you draw three cards that turn).
